title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1 ยง 3.22 - Storage of single-service containers, utensils and materials-item14p
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1 ยง 3.22 - Storage of single-service containers, utensils and materials-item14p

State Regulations
(a) Parchment
paper, containers, gaskets, liners, bags and other single-service articles used
in contact with milk, milk products, whey, and condensed and dry milk products
shall be purchased and stored in sanitary wrappings or cartons, kept in a
clean, dry place until used, and shall be handled in a sanitary
manner. (b) Paperboard shipping
containers used to enclose plastic bags or unfilled containers shall be used
only once unless other methods are employed to protect the containers from
contamination. (c) Cartons or boxes
from which contents have been partially removed shall be kept closed. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1

3.22

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
